definitions.definition: a person or thing that cleans something, in particular.
a person employed to clean the interior of a building.
a place of business where clothes and fabrics are dry-cleaned.
a device for cleaning, such as a vacuum cleaner.
a chemical substance used for cleaning.
free from dirt, marks, or stains.
synonyms: as clean as a whistle "keep the wound clean"

definitions.definition: having been washed since last worn or used.
(of paper) not yet marked by writing or drawing.
examples: he copied the directions onto a clean sheet of paper

definitions.definition: (of a person) attentive to personal hygiene.
examples: by nature he was clean and neat

definitions.definition: free from pollutants or unpleasant substances.
examples: we will create a cleaner, safer environment

definitions.definition: free from or producing relatively little radioactive contamination.
morally uncontaminated; pure; innocent.
synonyms: above suspicion; informalsqueaky clean "the firm is clean"

definitions.definition: not sexually offensive or obscene.
showing or having no record of offenses or crimes.
examples: a clean driving license is essential for the job

definitions.definition: played or done according to the rules.
examples: it was a good clean fight
synonyms: according to the rules; informalon the level "a good clean fight"

definitions.definition: not possessing or containing anything illegal, especially drugs or stolen goods.
examples: I searched him and his luggage, and he was clean

definitions.definition: (of a person) not taking or having taken drugs or alcohol.
examples: sober, teetotal, dry, nondrinking; Moredrug-free, off drugs; informalon the wagon "they are trying to stay clean"Moredrug-free, off drugs; on the wagon they are trying to stay clean

definitions.definition: free from ceremonial defilement, according to Mosaic Law and similar religious codes.
free from irregularities; having a smooth edge or surface.
examples: a clean fracture of the leg

definitions.definition: having a simple, well-defined, and pleasing shape.
examples: the clean lines and pared-down planes of modernism

definitions.definition: (of an action) smoothly and skillfully done.
examples: I still hadn't made a clean takeoff

definitions.definition: (of a taste, sound, or smell) giving a clear and distinctive impression to the senses; sharp and fresh.
(of timber) free from knots.
